alert.note: Alert for Northern Coos (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 04 at 10:19PM EST until January 05 at 5:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...WINTRY PRECIPITATION TO MAKE FOR SLIPPERY TRAVEL LATE TONIGHT AND THURSDAY... .Low pressure will move south of New England later today and tonight. It will initially start as rain except for in the mountains where snow and sleet is likely. Cooler air works southward across the region tonight and tomorrow changing the precipitation to a mix of light snow (confined mainly to the north), sleet, and freezing rain which should continue through at least Thursday morning allowing for slippery travel. Freezing drizzle is likely at times afterward with light snow occasionally mixing in. Further south, temperatures will take longer to cool however freezing drizzle and some freezing rain will be possible at times through the daylight hours of Thursday. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM EST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation. Total snow and sleet accumulations between 2 and 4 inches and ice accumulations around a light glaze. * WHERE...In Maine, Southern Somerset, Northern Franklin, Northern Oxford, and Southern Franklin Counties. In New Hampshire, Northern Coos County. * WHEN...Until 5 PM EST Thursday. * IMPACTS...A period of mixed precipitation is expected tonight and tomorrow. Expect slippery road conditions and avoid travel if possible. Even light snowfall amounts can accumulate on roads and cause dangerous driving conditions due to snow covered roads. The hazardous conditions will impact the Thursday morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Precipitation will be less intense during the day Thursday however freezing drizzle may still produce hazardous driving conditions, especially on untreated roads.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org
